author: Ground News
title: Ground News - This artwork grows the longer it's on display, and it's making history at Sculpture by the Sea
text: This artwork grows the longer it's on display, and it's making history at Sculpture by the Sea Noongar artist Sharyn Egan has returned to Sculpture by the Sea in Cottesloe, now in its 20th year. Her sculpture, titled Balga Boola – Bigsmob Balga, grows throughout the duration of the exhibition into a blossoming field of Balga trees. The 67-year-old artist was named the 2024 Tourism WA Invited Aboriginal Artist. Summary by Ground News 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right [] ABC Australia This artwork grows the longer it's on display, and it's making history at Sculpture by the Sea Art observers at Cottesloe Beach for this year's Sculpture by the Sea exhibition in Perth are rolling up their sleeves to help create Noongar artist Sharon Egan's sculpture. 1 hour ago·AustraliaRead Full Article Think freely.Subscribe and get full access to Ground NewsSubscriptions start at $9.99/year [Subscribe](/subscribe) Not enough coverage to generate an Article Assistant.
